Darwin in a nutshell. 3 observations and a coclusion drawn from them.
 
 Observation 1: Variation. Traits of individuals within a species show slight differences.
 
 Observation 2: Inheritance. Traits in all individuals get passed to any offspring.
 
 Observation 3: Competition. Individuals in a species compete for survival and reproduction.
 
 Conclusion: Natural selection. Individuals born with traits which give them any competitive advantage in survival or reproduction, will *on average* leave more offspring with those traits.
 
 That is the essence. Please show where the modern synthesis differs from this foundation.
